hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 10-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day rolling average by more than 30% (indicating extreme compression), and the BTC price is trading within +/-2% of its 20-day moving average in a NEUTRAL regime, the subsequent 5-day absolute return will exceed the average 5-day absolute return by at least 50%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility is mean-reverting. Extreme compression in a neutral, range-bound market often precedes a significant expansion in price movement as pent-up energy releases. The neutral regime filter avoids chasing breakouts in strong directional trends where the signal is less clean.
entry_conditions: BTC daily volume > 30-day average volume (confirms participation)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price closes >3.5% below 20D_SMA on day of entry
exit_conditions.time_exit: Close position at market on close of 5th trading day after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average 5-day absolute return following the signal is not statistically significantly greater than the unconditional 5-day absolute return (p-value > 0.1) over a test period of 100+ signals.
